page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO CIRENCESTER
page.content: Cirencester is an important centre for tourism occupying a central location on the Cotswolds. There is a twice weekly market held on the Medieval Market Place and the many good hotels, restaurants and shops give a general impression of prosperity. Yet here as elsewhere in the country there exists unemployment and social need particularly amongst the unskilled workers. There are 3 large supermarkets, a department store and a range of small shops which provide an important facility for the hamlets and villages around Cirencester. The town has grown rapidly over the past decade especially in light industry and housing. House prices range from Â£30,000 to Â£70,000. Many people commute to Swindon to work.
